articles.headline: S.& P. Index Climbs Past the Record It Set 7 Years Ago
articles.snippet: The most widely followed benchmark of American stocks surpassed a previous high set amid the Internet boom.
articles.abstract: The most widely followed benchmark of American stocks surpassed a previous high set amid the Internet boom.
articles.lead_paragraph: The stock market yesterday clawed back to where it was seven years ago during the heady days of technology and the Internet boom — and it had to overcome an overnight sell-off in China to get there.
articles.byline: By Vikas Bajaj and Jeremy W. Peters

articles.headline: Melamine From U.S. Put in Feed
articles.snippet: A manufacturing plant in Ohio was using the banned substance that ended up in feed for farmed fish, shrimp and livestock.
articles.abstract: A manufacturing plant in Ohio was using the banned substance that ended up in feed for farmed fish, shrimp and livestock.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ever since pet food contaminated with an industrial chemical was traced to shipments of wheat flour from China, American officials have concentrated on cracking down on imports.

articles.headline: Manufacturer of Risky Drug to Sell Shares
articles.snippet: Jazz Pharmaceuticals has filed to sell as much as $180 million in stock in its first public offering.
articles.abstract: Jazz Pharmaceuticals has filed to sell as much as $180 million in stock in its first public offering.
articles.lead_paragraph: Is a pharmaceutical company whose biggest-selling drug is considered as dangerous as heroin or LSD a good investment?

articles.headline: Jihadist Groups Fill a Palestinian Power Vacuum
articles.snippet: Islamist groups are vying for influence in Gaza in a race to fill the security vacuum created by fighting between Fatah and Hamas.
articles.abstract: Islamist groups are vying for influence in Gaza in a race to fill the security vacuum created by fighting between Fatah and Hamas.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM, May 30 — It was 2 a.m. when masked gunmen raided Al Wafa Net in the Khan Yunis camp in Gaza where 17 young men were surfing the Internet.
articles.byline: By Steven Erlanger and Hassan M. Fattah

articles.headline: Stir in G.O.P. as Ex-Senator Moves to Run
articles.snippet: Fred D. Thompson could shake up a field of candidates that has failed to strike a chord with the Republican base.
articles.abstract: Fred D. Thompson could shake up a field of candidates that has failed to strike a chord with the Republican base.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 30 — Former Senator Fred D. Thompson of Tennessee has taken new steps that make it clear that he is likely to run for the White House, potentially shaking up a field of candidates that has failed to strike a chord with the Republican base.
articles.byline: By Carl Hulse and Patrick Healy

articles.headline: Comedy Business Turns to the Web
articles.snippet: A video with Will Ferrell has become a sensation on a Web site that has the backing of a major venture capital firm.
articles.abstract: A video with Will Ferrell has become a sensation on a Web site that has the backing of a major venture capital firm.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — For Will Ferrell, who commands up to $20 million for movies like “Anchorman” and “Blades of Glory,” starring in a short Web video may not seem like the best use of time.
